results.title: The Little ark
results.creator_credit: Cinema Center Films, Robert B Radnitz and James B. Clark
results.brief_description: Two children in Holland, Jan Brink and Adinda de la Maison are orphaned after they are separated from their parents when a flood washes away their town. They are picked up by an Urker sea captain, along with the pets they have salvaged from the flood; a cat, rabbit, rooster and a dog. The captain proves to be a captivating story teller with the ability to teach values such as love and respect through his stories. Starring Monica Achterberg, Genevieve Ambas, Philip Frame and Theodore Bikel as the captain. Filmed entirely in Holland and based on the novel by Jan De Hartog.

results.title: Discovering the Murray-Darling Basin
results.creator_credit: Kenyon Castle Productions, Murray-Darling Basin Commission (Australia) and Kenyon Castle
results.brief_description: Mike Hayes presents this video which shows the immense variety of Australia’s most important agricultural region, stretching from Queensland to South Australia. Not only is the area important agriculturally, but it is also an area of great beauty, rich in wildlife, history and folk lore. Produced for the Murray-Darling Basin Commission the program stresses that almost everybody in Australia is dependent in some way on this vast area and that therefore we should be working to prevent further degradation and repair some of the damage which has already been done.

results.title: The Mew conspiracy
results.brief_description: When the original Pokemon games Red and Blue were released, players theorised widely about the whereabouts of Mew, the elusive 151st pokemon. One theory was that Mew was hiding under a hard-to-find truck near the SS Anne. When remakes FireRed and LeafGreen were released in 2004, players found the truck again. On examination, players are rewarded, not with a rare Pokemon, but with a cookie, as a nod to the conspiracy.

results.title: Bayi Gardiya (Singing Desert)
results.credit_line:
Creative technology studio: Nakatomi
Performed by Christian Thompson
Composed by Christian Thompson and Mark Mitchell
Sound production by Mark Mitchell at Electric Dreams Studio
With special thanks to Rachael Sheridan, Jeanette Little and Leyla Varela
results.material_description: 360 degree video, VR system, headphones, sand and AIATSIS map of Indigenous Australia
results.brief_description:
Bayi Gardiya (Singing Desert) is an immersive, 360 degree moving image and sound experience.

The environment within Bayi Gardiya situates a visitor in the creek bed of The Sixth Mile, Barcaline, western Queensland. The imagery and sound within transforms from morning to midday and then to twilight and night. These transitions also shift through seasonal change to represent and also comment on the impacts of Global Warming on the fragile, semi-desert Hinterland and country represented in the work.

results.title: Did you ask the river?
results.credit_line:
Joan Ross
Mordant Family VR Commission, ACMI Collection
Developed in collaboration with Dr Josh Harle at Tactical Space Lab, Sydney
results.material_description: software, video, props, colour and sound
results.brief_description:
‘Did you ask the river?’ is the debut VR work from one of Australia’s leading visual artists, Joan Ross.

In the style of a first-person videogame, participants are given free rein to explore an interactive 3D extension of Ross’s vibrant, yet unsettling, colonial landscapes.

Unlike many VR experiences, participants are placed in a body – that of an 18th century colonial woman – and become uncomfortably complicit in her unwitting destruction of the landscape.

results.title: The Milgram re-enactment
results.brief_description: This docudrama re-enactment of psychologist Stanley Milgram’s case studies on “Obedience to Authority” was commissioned by the Centre for Contemporary Art, Glasgow and took place on 15th and 17th February 2002. The original controversial experiments took place at Yale from 1961-1962 and involved the “experimenter”, a “teacher” and a “learner” to investigate the effects of punishment on learning - the punishment consisting of a series of shocks for wrong answers with the voltage increasing by 15 increments with each wrong answer, beginning at 15 volts up to a maximum of 450 volts. However instead of the “learner”, it is actually the “teacher” who is the guinea pig and who is being studied to see just how far a subject will continue to administer pain whilst following orders. A very interesting study that makes the viewer experience various emotions from distress, frustration and even anger at the way humans can behave in certain situations. Cast: Graeme Edler (Experimenter), Charles Donelly (Leaner).

results.title: Women in the surf
results.brief_description: The first non-fiction feature about Australia’s women of the surf tells the history of women’s surfing in Australia from 1915. It moves through the big board era to the present day, with women becoming a surfing entity in their own right. The video shows the women surf riders surfing their own calender and tells of their hopes, fears and pleasures as they ride the waves.

results.title: Running out of patience
results.brief_description: In October 1986, Victorian nurses began an historic strike action which was to last 50 days. This video is the nurses version of the dispute. Despite widespread condemnation mainly from the media, the nurses eventually won out for an appropriate career structure including significant pay increases. Actual strike footage together with nursing training films and old photographs explore vocational stereotypes and place the strike in the context of the current crisis in the health care system.

results.title: Winter's harvest = Raccolta d'inverno
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Council, Brian McKenzie and Angelo Gigliotti
results.brief_description: A documentary on a group of Italian families living in Australia. Shows how they continue some of their traditional customs, in particular the slaughtering and processing of a pig into salami and meat for winter. Captures the essence of traditional Italian family life; the cooperation between families, the division of labour between men and women and the camaraderie that comes from working as a team.

results.title: Winter's harvest
results.brief_description: An Italian family in suburban Melbourne slaughter a pig, make sausages and soups from the flesh, and enjoy a tremendous feast. Brian McKenzie’s fascinating documentary about peasant tradition in the “new world” is a film that asks us to be witness to life and to death, to contemplate the nostalgia of place and displacement, which allows us to remember a world that we have a lost.
